main_definition: A public sale where goods or property are sold to the highest bidder.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An event where items are sold to the highest bidder through competitive bidding.
meanings_and_examples.example: The vintage car was put up for auction at the local garage.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A method of selling property, often used by banks or governments when foreclosing on a property.
meanings_and_examples.example: The bank held an auction to sell the house after the owner failed to pay the mortgage.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An informal term for a competitive bidding process where participants compete to purchase an item or service.
meanings_and_examples.example: John attended the silent auction at the charity gala, hoping to win the gift basket raffle.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A type of fundraising event where items are sold for profit with a portion going towards a cause.
meanings_and_examples.example: The non-profit organization organized an auction to raise money for their local homeless shelter.
